intro: Cynoglossum argaeum, commonly known as the blueweed or forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Cynoglossum argaeum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
